item.description:
It's always hard to schedule a full-moon paddle.  Even though the moon rises at a set time, it takes it a while to get above the trees so we can see it.  On the actual date of the full moon (July 15), it rises in conjunction with the sunset.  That would be beautiful if you had an unobstructed view to the east and west and a clear sky. Taking our venue, moonrise time and the weather forecast into consideration (plus my schedule), I have planned this meetup.  This trip is not suitable for beginners.

On Sunday night (forecast to be clear) the moon rises at 4:09 PM and it will be at its highest point in the sky at around 9:00 PM,  79% illuminated.   Sunset is at 8:22.

Please be in your kayak and ready to paddle by 7:45.  This will give people a chance to admire the area before it gets dark.  Expect to spend about 2 hours on the water.  Required equipment will be a whistle, flashlight or headlamp (check your batteries before you leave home) and a properly fastened PFD to be worn at all times.  We will paddle in complete darkness with our only light from the moon.  Massachusetts law only requires using your flashlight or headlamp in time to avoid a potential collision.  Paddling without the headlamps will avoid being "blinded" by other paddler's lights.

The boat launch is on route 135 between Westborough and Hopkinton Centers.  Use the intersection of Dale Road and Route 135 in Hopkinton if using a GPS.

(PLEASE NOTE - The organizers in this group are NOT trained leaders or instructors.  The organizers only set the time and place, each person participating in any group trip is responsible for their own safety.  Each participant is responsible for evaluating all relevant conditions for the trip and determining if their skills and equipment are appropriate for those conditions.)
item.name: Paddle under almost full moon
